reviews.text: I came here for dinner with my husband and son. My husband had pizza and I had seafood spaghetti. The food was delicious. I've been eating here since before the restaurant moved and it never disappoints me. But there are not enough waiters.

I really did enjoy the food at this spot, the personnel is welcoming and the ambient is relaxed and easygoing, i had pasta and lamb for the secound course, the portions was generous enough and the price in line with italian meals. I also appreciated the change in the cousine because is quite different from the previous time i've eaten here. A+ reccomanded

Where is the old Italia? Food below average, tomato carpacio was good though. Undercooked pasta and chewy lamb...cream sauce was plain and not checked for the right flavour. Pizza base without taste. I wonder why people complain about taste but owners trying to explain that it is their taste... keep doing what you're doing and none will come back... Lady from Greece, who was serving us, was very professional and gentleman from Ukraine did care about our experience and listened to our comments, big plus. In an open kitchen there should not be people who are not up to standards and by law required to wear the right uniform. I'm disappointed to see this kitchen has no right standard.
Carbonara is made perfectly here! Satisfied my pasta craving. Much better than I expected as we are in Reykjavik after all, not Rome!

Must have been almost two decades ago I was here last. Decided to check out the reviews and wasn’t really looking forward to going but I’m glad we decided to go because the food we ordered was so delicious. Will come back and bring the kids with me next time.

The prices on the menu on their site has gone up so that needs updating.
